Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
All charges against Joseph A Kohlmann in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph A Kohlmann is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A Kohlmann

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Katherine Graber in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling conference. Defendant is deceased.   On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant Joseph A Kohlmann in court with Attorney Katherine Graber; both appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Joseph A Kohlmann in court in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Joseph A Kohlmann in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Joseph A Kohlmann in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
